title: The Largest Healthcare Contract in American History Just Hit the Street
description: On January 21, 2026, the VA held a landmark industry event for the largest healthcare contract ever. What contractors need to know.

title: The VA Is Executing the Largest Healthcare Reorganization Since the 1990s
description: If you're not paying attention to the VA's restructuring, you're already behind. Here's what the reorganization means for contractors.

title: VA Solicits Demos for Next-Gen Referral and Care Coordination System
description: VA's OIT posted an RFI for a next-generation referral, authorization, utilization management, and care coordination system.

title: Healthcare's Agentic AI Reckoning: The Operating Model Shift No One Can Postpone
description: IBM's 2025 report reveals organizations mastering AI adoption are 32X more likely to reach top-tier performance. 78% of execs say a new operating model is required.

title: Somewhere in the Pacific: When Telehealth Routes Through Contested Systems
description: A Navy corpsman is waiting on a telehealth consult that routes through systems maintained by contested infrastructure. The readiness implications are real.

title: The MHS Triad: What Their Appointment Actually Means
description: Last week we introduced the MHS Triad. This week, what Keith Bass, Emil Michael, and their appointment actually signals for defense health.

title: Meet the MHS Triad: Keith Bass, Emil Michael, and the Silicon Valley Bet
description: The political architect, the Silicon Valley operator, and what their installation means for the future of military healthcare.

title: On Keeping Your COTS Products in the Mattress
description: After the Great Depression, people kept money in the mattress. Some defense health IT vendors are doing the same with their COTS products.

title: We're Official: Introducing Fed UP
description: Sara Byrd and I have been talking about doing this for months. Fed UP: Where Mission Meets Reality is live.

title: Pixels and Promises: The Fragmented Foundation of MHS Imaging (Part 1)
description: At 2 a.m. at Camp Lejeune, a medic's tablet stalls. In Kandahar, a CT scan saves a life in minutes. The paradox of MHS enterprise imaging.

title: From Silos to Synergy: Building the Future of MHS Enterprise Imaging (Part 2)
description: From diagnosis to action â€” charting the path to unify MHS imaging through DTRS, VNAs, cloud, and AI across 700+ facilities.
